name: gravel and sand quarry operation | sand | Cutoff, U
description:
ecoQuery: https://ecoquery.ecoinvent.org/3.10/cutoff/dataset/2703/documentation

This dataset corresponds to the production of 1 kg of sand (35%) and gravel (65%). From the total sectoral production volume (100%) of mined gravel round, crushed and sand, about 85% is gravel round and sand.  ;[This dataset was already contained in the ecoinvent database version 2. It was not individually updated during the transfer to ecoinvent version 3. Life Cycle Impact Assessment results may still have changed, as they are affected by changes in the supply chain, i.e. in other datasets. This dataset was generated following the ecoinvent quality guidelines for version 2. It may have been subject to central changes described in the ecoinvent version 3 change report (http://www.ecoinvent.org/database/ecoinvent-version-3/reports-of-changes/), and the results of the central updates were reviewed extensively. The changes added e.g. consistent water flows and other information throughout the database. The documentation of this dataset can be found in the ecoinvent reports of version 2, which are still available via the ecoinvent website. The change report linked above covers all central changes that were made during the conversion process.]

From gravel and sand at ground, unexcavated.

This activity ends with the gravel and sand digged and the recultivation process done. The dataset includes the whole manufacturing process for digging of gravel round and sand (no crushed gravel), internal processes (transport, etc.),  infrastructure for the operation (machinery) and land-use of the mine (incl. unpaved roads). The dataset doesn't include the land-use of the paved roads and buildings, the administration, dust emissions (because it is mostly a 'wet' process) and wastewater (because process water is not polluted -only sand and gravel- and therefore directly seeped).
category: B:Mining and quarrying/08:Other mining and quarrying/081:Quarrying of stone, sand and clay/0810:Quarrying of stone, sand and clay

processDocumentation.geographyDescription: Data was obtained from Swiss industries.
processDocumentation.technologyDescription: The typical technology for swiss gravel and sand mining was assumed.
processDocumentation.samplingDescription: Measured data of four Swiss plants

exchanges.description:
The largest use of construction sand and gravel is as aggregate for the production of concrete. The second largest use is as foundation material for highways, railways, runways, etc. Other major uses include aggregate for hot mix asphalt, and filler for highway, dam, and other back-filling. Smaller volumes of construction sand and gravel are used in plaster and gunite sands, snow and ice control, and railroad ballast. 
The amounts of reference products were expressed relative to the production volumes.

flow.name: sand
flow.category: B:Mining and quarrying/08:Other mining and quarrying/081:Quarrying of stone, sand and clay/0810:Quarrying of stone, sand and clay

exchanges.description:
Estimation. The machines used for the mining of sand and gravel are considered: 3 sieves (assuming each 5t), 5 'small' silos (assuming each 7t), 1 barrel washer (20 t) and other machines (30t). The total weight of the machines considered is 100 t. The service life of all these machines is assumed to be 25 years. The part of the machines which belongs to the mining process itself is included in the module 'gravel/sand mine'. Wearing parts and lubricating oil is taken into account. The total amount of material treated by these machines over 25 years is therefore about 743.75 Mio tons.
Estimation. The machines used for the mining of sand and gravel are considered: 3 sieves (assuming each 5t), 5 'small' silos (assuming each 7t), 1 barrel washer (20 t) and other machines (30t). The part of the machines which belongs to the mining process itself is included in the module 'gravel/sand mine'. Wearing parts and lubricating oil is taken into account. The total amount of material treated by these machines over 25 years is therefore about 743.75 Mio tons.

exchanges.description:
Proxy, based on literature values. 'Recultivation, limestone mine' is used as proxy, an important difference is the amount of transformation to a certain area which is just left to nature.
This exchange has an activity link directly to the producing activity because the product is primarily consumed in the same geographical area where it is produced.

exchanges.description:
Estimation. A conveyor belt with a lenght of 1.000m was assumed, considering that the 85% is used for the transportation of crushed gravel. A service life of 25 years was estimated. The yearly production amount considered was 357,548.25 tons (85% of 420,645).

exchanges.description:
Estimation. A total area of the mine is estimated in 12'000m2. However, 3'000m2 are included in the module 'gravel/sand quarry construction' and the remaining 9'000m2 are accounted in this dataset. The estimated service life is 50 years. The average yearly yield of the mine is the 85% of 420,465 t/a.
This exchange has an activity link directly to the producing activity because the product is primarily consumed in the same geographical area where it is produced.
